text: Better a poor person walking in integrity
than one who is perverse ⸤in his speech⸥\f + \fr 19:1 \ft Literally “in his lips” \f* and is a fool.
Also, a life\f + \fr 19:2 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* without knowledge is not good,
and he who moves quickly with \add his\add* feet ⸤misses the mark⸥.\f + \fr 19:2 \ft Or “sins” \f*
As for the folly of humankind, its way leads to ruin,
and against Yahweh his heart\f + \fr 19:3 \ft Or “mind” \f* will rage.
Wealth adds many friends,
but the poor will be left by his friends.
A witness of falsehood will not go unpunished,
and he who breathes lies will not escape.
Many will seek favor before the generous,
and everyone \add is\add* the friend of a man of gifts.\f + \fr 19:6 \ft Hebrew “gift” \f*
All the brothers of the poor, \add if\add* they hate him,
how much more will his friends keep away from him.
He pursues \add them with\add* words, \add and\add* they are gone.\f + \fr 19:7 \ft Or “\fq when \ft he pursues words \fq and \ft not them” \f*
He who acquires wisdom loves himself;\f + \fr 19:8 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
he who guards understanding \add loves\add* to find good.
A false witness will not go unpunished,
and he who breathes lies will perish.
For a fool living in luxury is not fitting,
\add any\add* more \add than it is\add* for a slave to rule over princes.
The understanding of a person makes him slow to his ⸤anger⸥,\f + \fr 19:11 \ft Literally “nostril” \f*
and his glory overlooks offense.
The rage of a king growls like a lion,
but his favor is like dew on the grass.
A foolish child is a ruin to his father,
and the quarreling of a woman\f + \fr 19:13 \ft Or “wife” \f* is a continuous dripping.
A house and wealth \add are\add* an inheritance \add from\add* fathers,
but from Yahweh \add comes\add* a woman\f + \fr 19:14 \ft Or “wife” \f* who is prudent.
Laziness will bring on a deep sleep,
and a person\f + \fr 19:15 \ft Or “soul,” or “life” \f* of idleness will suffer hunger.
He who guards commandments guards his life;\f + \fr 19:16 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
he who is careless of his ways will be killed.
He who lends to Yahweh \add is\add* he who is kind to the poor,
and his benefits he will repay to him.
Discipline your child, for there is hope,
but on his destruction do not set your desire.\f + \fr 19:18 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
A hot-tempered person pays a penalty;
if you rescue \add him\add*, you will do \add it\add* yet again.
Listen \add to\add* advice and accept instruction
so that you will gain wisdom for your ⸤future⸥.\f + \fr 19:20 \ft Literally “after \fq things \ft ” \f*
Many plans \add are\add* in the heart\f + \fr 19:21 \ft Or “mind” \f* of a man,
but the purpose of Yahweh will be established.
The craving of a man \add is\add* his steadfast loyalty,
and \add it is\add* better \add to be\add* poor than a ⸤liar⸥.\f + \fr 19:22 \ft Literally “man of lying” \f*
Fear of Yahweh \add leads\add* to life;
he who is filled \add with it\add* will rest—he will not suffer harm.
A lazy person buries his hand in the dish,
and even to his mouth he will not bring it back.
The scoffer you shall strike, and the simple, may they learn prudence,
and reprove the intelligent \add and\add* he will gain knowledge.
He who does violence to a father, he who chases away a mother,
\add is\add* a child who causes shame and brings reproach.
Cease to listen to instruction, my child,
⸤and you will stray⸥\f + \fr 19:27 \ft Literally “\fq in order \ft to stray” \f* from sayings of knowledge.
A worthless witness will mock justice,
and the mouth of the wicked will devour iniquity.
Judgments\f + \fr 19:29 \ft Or “Punishments,” or “Condemnations” \f* are prepared for the scoffers,
and flogging for the back of fools.
